summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeVeganGive BackMilani Baked Blush - Radiant Powder Blush is a richly pigmented and ultra-buildable radiant powder blush formula, baked to perfection on Italian Terracotta tiles.
details: DetailsFeaturesRichly pigmented, ultra-blendable and highly buildable powder blushBuildable formula allows for a variety of looks, from a subtle glow to a bold beatPerfect cheeky pop of color for all skin tonesVersatile formula makes helps shape, contour or highlight your best featuresBenefitsSuperfine pigments sunbaked on Italian Terracotta tiles leave a natural wash of color with a luminous, soft glowMade in ItalyCruelty-FreeFormulated WithoutParabensItem 2519994How To UseApply blush to the apples of the cheek and blend. Sweep excess across the hairline and bridge of the nose for all-over glow.IngredientsMica, Talc, Dimethicone, Isopropyl Palmitate, Polysorbate 20, Acrylamide/Sodium Acryloyldimethyltaurate Copolymer, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Octyldodecyl Stearoyl Stearate, Cetearyl Ethylhexanoate, Caprylyl Glycol, Isohexadecane, Sorbitan Stearate, Lauroyl Lysine, Phenoxyethanol, Sodium Dehydroacetate, Simmondsia Chinensis (Jojoba) Seed Oil, Tocopheryl Acetate, Polysorbate 80, Hexylene Glycol, Tin Oxide, Nylon-12, Sorbitan Oleate, Calcium Sodium Borosilicate, Synthetic Fluorphlogopite, Calcium Aluminum Borosilicate, Silica +/- May Contain: Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891), Iron Oxides (CI 77491, CI 77492, CI 77499), Red 7 (CI 15850), Red 6 (CI 15850), Ultramarines (CI 77007),Yellow 5 (CI 19140), Yellow 6 Lake (CI 15985).
how_to_use: Apply blush to the apples of the cheek and blend. Sweep excess across the hairline and bridge of the nose for all-over glow.

reviews.headline: Good!
reviews.comments: since Nars changed their blush formula, I've been searching high and low for a dupe for their orga blush. it's just not good anymore and you get no pigment. Google told me that this blush in Dolce Pink would be a good dupe. the blush is very pretty, but it's not the color I was looking for. it has good pigment and is blendable, but I'm going to order Bella Ballini in hopes it's closer to the color I'm looking for!

reviews.headline: Yes I would buy again
reviews.comments: This baked blush is a beautiful dupe for the Laura Gellar baked  blush. It is highly pigmented and I also makes a great eyeshadow. I have mature skin and this looks creamy and light. Not your old lady blush.

reviews.headline: I loved this!
reviews.comments: I loved how natural looking it made my FACE.Also the shade Luminoso makes you look so fresh faced and cute.The glow is just perfect.

reviews.headline: Best Blush
reviews.comments: I have used blushes at ALL price points. Was previously a Nars die hard fan. I bought this blush in the  Luminoso shade to save some money, and i will never go back to expensive blush. Ive even had people ask what blush im wearing now which i can assure you has never happened before.

reviews.headline: Beautiful glowy blush
reviews.comments: I really like the color and consistency of this blush. I feel like its very pigmented. I often only wear a little concealer and mascara. When i add this blush it makes me feel like i look more healthy, awake, and youthful.

reviews.headline: Yes yes and yes
reviews.comments: I went in with a liquid blushlighter looking for a powder to match it and the Ulta consultant recommended this one as her favorite. It is absolutely beautiful and goes very well with my liquid. Very pigmented so a little goes a long way

reviews.headline: very pretty!
reviews.comments: Color is really pretty! Goes on easy. Gave 4 stars instead of 5 only because it's much more gold than I expected. But still very pretty!

reviews.headline: I would buy again
reviews.comments: Very good...only takes a small amount..definitely recommend

reviews.headline: Love this
reviews.comments: I am an older woman so this color, Dolce Pink, appeared to be pretty vibrant for me.  However, I love it!  It is so sheer and imparts a beautiful glow!  I am very pleased with this purchase.

reviews.headline: Glowing
reviews.comments: A good blush.

reviews.headline: My go to
reviews.comments: This blush is pignented and leaves you with an amazing finish..!

reviews.headline: My go to
reviews.comments: This blush is pignented and leaves you with an amazing finish..!

reviews.headline: My go to blush
reviews.comments: Milani's baked blushes have been my favorites for years! Love the colors and pigmentation on them.

reviews.headline: All Warm
reviews.comments: I have no idea why some.companies don't understand that aome people need cool blushes. Everything is peach or "warm pink". c'mon.

reviews.headline: I would buy this product again.
reviews.comments: The low prize is wonderful and the product is good!

reviews.headline: a bit underwhelmed
reviews.comments: i can see how this works well for others. maybe its the shade i got, but the pigment was barely there. even when i tried building it up, i mostly just got sparkles with no color pay off. willing to try it again, i hope they release diff shades in the future

reviews.headline: So far so good
reviews.comments:
Not sure how long it will last, its not a very loose powder so u need a strong brush to pick at it, it seems like a little goes a long way, i was afraid the pink would be too much but it looks good 
I think id repurcchase tho

reviews.headline: best baked blush
reviews.comments: legendary baked blush, gives you that healthy glowy skin. only downside is a little bit powdery

reviews.headline: Too red
reviews.comments: Returning blush

reviews.headline: Too red. Fake
reviews.comments: I would like to return

media.headline: I LOVE these Blushes So Much! I Have FIVE of Them
media.caption: 5 Baked Blushes and 1 Baked Bronzer!

faceoff_positive.comments: I have 02- Rose D'oro (the first one I bought. It's gorgeous)- a sophisticated rose with a golden glow and a touch of brown. 05 - Luminoso a beautiful melon/peachy color that works on everyone. This also has great iridescence. 12 Bella Bellini- I love this one. It's pinky-peach with a more opal-like glow. It works beautifully layers over #13 13 Rosa Romantica a lighter glow that is more of a paler pink with gold and lighter shade glow 15 Sunset Passion- a warm rose bronze that is lighter than Rose D'Oro. This one is great on the eyes and can be used as a bronzer as well as a base layer of blush and use 13 Rosa Romantica over it to great the highlights. In the attached photo I have the colors in numerical order from left to right (02-15) I also featured the Baked Bronzer (04 Glow) I have too which is such a great color to wear as blush, bronzer or even eye shadow. The BAKED series is absolutely killer. I am not usually obsessed with one brand and I never buy various colors quickly but these were too good to pass up so when I saw a color I thought would work for me (usually newer ones), I bought it over the last 5-6 months. Each of these blushes and the bronzer go on as sheer washes. I apply with a small kabuki brush and along the cheekbone up to my hairline above my ear. I use the brush to blend it out well and if I need a bit more highlight, I add in another layer of color from a lighter blush.
faceoff_positive.headline: I LOVE these Blushes So Much! I Have FIVE of Them

faceoff_negative.comments: I have fair to light skin with pink undertones. I was looking for a light pink blush because everything turns orange on me. I selected Rosa Romantica based on the recommendations. It has no pink in it. It is practically a yellow/orange/gold color with brown streaks going through it. It is not pink at all. The blush itself is great quality, goes on well and does not make me break out, but just not a good color for me.
faceoff_negative.headline: Color is not what I wanted
